str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
Much, many; often.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
Thunder. Akin to bremo; thunder.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
From kithara and a derivative of the same as oide; a lyre-singer(-player), i.e. Harpist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: Intrans. and trans: I play on the harp, I harp, with acc. of the tune. From kithara; to play on a lyre.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A harp, lyre. Of uncertain affinity; a lyre.
